dt: {bc}to speak or express opinions in a pompous or dogmatic way

dt.t: He does not {wi}pontificate{/wi} about whether one ought to choose, if forced to it, to betray one's country rather than one's friends …

What these interviews generally come down to is an invitation to writers to {wi}pontificate{/wi} upon things for which it is either unseemly for them to speak (the quality of their own work) or upon which they are unfit to judge (the state of the cosmos).

et: Medieval Latin {it}pontificatus{/it}, past participle of {it}pontificare{/it}, from Latin {it}pontific-, pontifex{/it}
shortdef: to speak or express opinions in a pompous or dogmatic way
